content: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic, and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal spatial and temporal relationships (e.g., After dinner that night we went looking for them).
Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

content: Speak in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.
Create engaging audio recordings of stories or poems that demonstrate fluid reading at an understandable pace; add visual displays when appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace.
Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.
Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

content: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

content: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic.
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

content: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and collaborate with others.
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.
With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose.
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.
meta: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

content: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 2—3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.
meta: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

content: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.
Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).
Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).
Distinguish their own point of view from that of the author of a text.
Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area. (See grade 3 Language standards 4–6 for additional expectations.)

Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.
Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.
Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 2—3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.
meta: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

content: Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).
Explain how specific aspects of a text's illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).
Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.
Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language. (See grade 3 Language standards 4–6 for additional expectations.)
Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.
Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.
Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.
Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.
meta: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
meta: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

content: Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).
meta: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

content: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people who are friendly or helpful).
meta: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

content: Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).
meta: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

content: Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases in all content areas.
meta: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

content: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).
meta: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

content: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).
meta: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

content: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
meta: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

content: Recognize and observe differences between the conventions of spoken and written standard English.
meta: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

content: Choose words and phrases for effect.
meta: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

content: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Use spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, position-based spellings, syllable patterns, ending rules, meaningful word parts) in writing words.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Use conventional spelling for high-frequency and other studied words and for adding suffixes to base words (e.g., sitting, smiled, cries, happiness).
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Form and use possessives.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Use commas and quotation marks in dialogue.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Use commas in addresses.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Capitalize appropriate words in titles.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

content: Use reciprocal pronouns correctly.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Write legibly in cursive or joined italics, allowing margins and correct spacing between letters in a word and words in a sentence.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use coordinating and subordinating conjunctions.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Ensure subject-verb and pronoun-antecedent agreement.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Form and use the simple (e.g., I walked; I walk; I will walk) verb tenses.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Form and use regular and irregular verbs.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Use abstract nouns (e.g., childhood).
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Form and use regular and irregular plural nouns.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.
meta: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

content: Plan and deliver an informative/explanatory presentation on a topic that: organizes ideas around major points of information, follows a logical sequence, includes supporting details, uses clear and specific vocabulary, and provides a strong conclusion.
meta: Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace.

content: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.
meta: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

content: Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others.
meta: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

content: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).
meta: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

content: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.
meta: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

content: Provide a sense of closure.
meta: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

content: Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.
meta: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

content: Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations.
meta: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

content: Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.
meta: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

content: Provide a concluding statement or section.
meta: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

content: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.
meta: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

content: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.
meta: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

content: Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension.
meta: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

content: Provide a concluding statement or section.
meta: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

content: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion and reasons.
meta: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

content: Provide reasons that support the opinion.
meta: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

content: Introduce the topic or text they are writing about, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure that lists reasons.
meta: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

content: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.
meta: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

content: Read on-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings
meta: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

content: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.
meta: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

content: Read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Decode multisyllable words.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Decode words with common Latin suffixes.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.

content: Identify and know the meaning of the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes.
meta: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.
